meanings.definition: Treat (something sacred) with irreverence or disrespect.
meanings.sent1: The children were profaning the church by running and shouting during the service.
meanings.sent2: He was caught profaning the cemetery by spray painting graffiti on the tombstones.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel seemed to be profaning the peaceful garden by digging up all the flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her careless actions were profaning the trust that had been built between them.
meanings.sent5: The storm seemed to be profaning the once beautiful landscape with its destructive winds.

meanings.sent1: The vandals were profaning the temple by breaking the stained glass windows.
meanings.sent2: It is a serious offense to profane a burial site by disturbing the graves.
meanings.sent3: The raccoons seemed to be profaning the campsite by rummaging through the trash cans.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti on the historic building seemed to profane its rich history.
meanings.sent5: The intruders were profaning the privacy of the secluded cabin by trespassing.
